page.title: 06Miss Shepherd of N.Stifford.
page.content: When interviewed Miss Shepherd said she had lived in N.Stifford for 30yrs The cottage she lives in was a small part of a once, much larger one.She came to the area to teach. Miss Shepherd loves nature and the countryside,she gets many small animals and birds visiting her garden. Once,she had a magpie nesting in a blackbird's nest.There have been badgers too.One night some years ago, she heard a banging noise,only to find in the morning that the badgers had demolished a newly erected fence put up by her neighbours, which happened to be across the badgers run. Miss Shepherd is a keen potter and makes and decorates mugs. The cottage was once a post office but it closed in 1900,now it is called 'The Old Post Cottage'It was prior to that a 'tied' cottage. by V.Clark.
